name: litigiousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being too willing or too likely to start a legal case, for example in order to solve a disagreement: The problem is the litigiousness of American society. The organization's litigiousness prevents many journalists from writing about it. See
litigious
More examplesFewer examplesHe has a reputation for litigiousness.Rising litigiousness among students means that staff have to keep records of their dealings with students. Given media coverage of huge compensation payments and increasing litigiousness, claims could rise dramatically.
